intro: Eriudaphus ecklonii, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and hardiness. Eriudaphus ecklonii is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a resilient choice for landscaping.
